page.title: 10Wolf's Caves, St. John
page.content: Along the north coast of Jersey there are many caves. The most well known are the{Wolf's Caves. { From the restaurant at{Fremont}which is also called Wolf's Caves,after having a drink in the bar, or a cup of tea or coffee, one can go down the 400ft. cliff by means of a stepped path to visit these caves. One can only go through the narrow entrance to the caves if the tide is low. { { Legend}has it that many years ago {smugglers}hid their booty in the caves. In order to deter others from entering the Caves, the smugglers made wolf noises and although there is no evidence that{wolves}actually existed this is how the caves got their name. No one knows for sure if it is true, so the story remains a legend.
